statement.p: Consider the functions r and s given in Figure and Figure.

li.p: On the same axes as the plot of y = r(x), sketch the following graphs: y = g(x) = 3r(x) and y = h(x) = \frac{1}{3}r(x). Be sure to label several points on each of r, g, and h with arrows to indicate their correspondence. In addition, write one sentence to explain the overall transformations that have resulted in g and h from r.

On the same axes as the plot of y = s(x), sketch the following graphs: y = k(x) = -s(x) and y = j(x) = -\frac{1}{2}s(x). Be sure to label several points on each of r, g, and h with arrows to indicate their correspondence. In addition, write one sentence to explain the overall transformations that have resulted in g and h from r.

On the additional copies of the two figures below, sketch the graphs of the following transformed functions: y = m(x) = 2r(x+1)-1 (at left) and y = n(x) = \frac{1}{2}s(x-2)+2. As above, be sure to label several points on each graph and indicate their correspondence to points on the original parent function.
Describe in words how the function y = m(x) = 2r(x+1)-1 is the result of three elementary transformations of y = r(x). Does the order in which these transformations occur matter? Why or why not?
